title: MIBiG Submission form
description: Please fill out this form to submit MIBiG-compliant annotation data on a biosynthetic gene cluster.

submitter_institution.title: Your institution
submitter_institution.description: Please use the full, official name of your institute in English.

biosyn_class.title: Biosynthetic class
biosyn_class.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple classes in the case of a hybrid gene cluster. Select all categories that apply: e.g., a polyketide with sugar monomers attached should be both 'Polyketide' and 'Saccharide'.

publications.title: Key publications associated with this gene cluster, pathway or molecule
publications.description: Publications describing experiments on this pathway. Please input PubMed IDs, separated by commas.

loci.title: Gene cluster sequence information
loci.description: Specify the gene cluster sequence as deposited/submitted in/to GenBank (or ENA/DDBJ). If the pathway is split over multiple clusters, add multiple genomic locus entries below. The genome or gene cluster sequence must be submitted to GenBank/ENA/DDBJ (and an accession number must be received) before this form can be filled out.

Accession.title: GenBank nucleotide accession number
Accession.description: E.g., AL645882. Only use GenBank accessions, not RefSeq accessions or GI numbers.

mixs_compliant.description: Whether the GBK/EMBL/DDBJ is annotated with metadata according to the MIxS standard (Yilmaz et al. Nat Biotechnol 29: 415â€“420).

start_coord.title: Start coordinate
start_coord.description: May be left empty if gene cluster covers entire GenBank nucleotide record.

end_coord.title: End coordinate
end_coord.description: May be left empty if gene cluster covers entire GenBank nucleotide record.

conn_comp_cluster.title: Evidence of involvement
conn_comp_cluster.description: Type of evidence that shows that this gene cluster is responsible for the biosynthesis of the designated molecules.

compounds.title: Chemical compound(s)
compounds.description: Add one entry for each molecule produced from this pathway / gene cluster.

chem_synonyms.title: Synonyms for this compound
chem_synonyms.description: Synonyms for the compound, separated by commas.

database_deposited.description: Whether there is an entry for the molecule on PubChem, chEMBL, chEBI or ChemSpider. If there is an entry but this does contain the correct chemical structure, please do not tick the box to enable you to input updated data.

databases_deposited.title: Database(s) that contain(s) this molecule.
databases_deposited.description: When selecting (multiple) databases, please note that it should concern entries representing exactly the same molecule, with the exact same structure and molecular formula (not a derivative or variant).

chebi_id.title: ChEBI ID
chebi_id.description: Please insert the number only. E.g., '42355' for 'CHEBI:42355'.

chembl_id.title: ChEMBL ID
chembl_id.description: Please insert the number only. E.g., '273387' for 'CHEMBL273387'.

chem_struct.title: Compound structure
chem_struct.description: Chemical structure entered as SMILES string, preferentially isomeric

mol_mass.title: Exact molecular mass
mol_mass.description: Exact molecular mass in Daltons. Use a dot as a decimal point, not a comma.

evidence_struct.title: Technique(s) used to elucidate/verify the structure
evidence_struct.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items.

chem_act.title: Molecular activities
chem_act.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items. Enter only proven activities; always provide the publication IDs where the evidence was provided under 'Key publications' above.

chem_target.title: Molecular targets
chem_target.description: Enter proteins, RNAs or other (macro)molecules targeted by this compound, separated by commas. Enter only proven targets; always provide the publication IDs where the evidence was provided under 'Key publications' below.

chem_moieties.title: Unusual chemical moieties in this molecule
chem_moieties.description: With 'unusual', it is meant that they are not covered by NRPS/PKS/RiPP/terpene/saccharide biosynthetic mechanisms. Moieties synthesized by a separate PKS like 6-methylsalicylic acid should also be indicated.

subcluster.title: Subcluster involved in the biosynthesis of this moiety
subcluster.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

genes.title: Genes in this gene cluster
genes.description: Add custom gene names OR annotations of experimentally verified functional or expression data for those genes for which this is available. You do not need to create items for genes on which no experimental data are available. These will be detected in the GenBank entry and added to the visualization automatically.

_key.title: Gene name
_key.description: Custom gene name. E.g., 'eryA'. Not needed if the GenBank entry already contains this information in a 'gene' tag within the corresponding CDS feature.

gene_id.title: Gene ID
gene_id.description: Enter locus tag, protein ID or gene ID (in this order of preference) exactly as it is specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry.

mut_pheno.title: Knockout mutation phenotype for this gene, if known

operon_genes.title: Genes in operon
operon_genes.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) that make up this operon, exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, from 5' to 3', separated by commas.

lin_cycl_nrp.description: Also counts as cyclic if the molecule is hybrid and the NRP cyclizes onto another part of the hybrid molecule. Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids or ketide groups do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected.

nrps_genes.title: NRPS genes in cluster
nrps_genes.description: Nonribosomal peptide synthetase-encoding genes; use locus tags or protein IDs matching those in the GenBank entry

_key.title: NRPS-encoding gene
_key.description: Enter locus tag, protein ID or gene ID (in this order of preference) exactly as it is specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry.

module_nr.title: Assembly line module number
module_nr.description: Enter the modules from N- to C-terminus in this gene. Counting starts from 1 at the start of the assembly-line (which can cover multiple genes), and includes loading modules when present (which are numbered '0'). Every module with at least an A-domain (or CAL/AT-domain, in the case of hybrid assembly-lines) is included. For hybrids, PKS modules are included in the counting. If this NRPS module is not part of a main assembly-line for producing this compound or if the NRPS complex is too noncanonical to describe in a linear fashion, please enter 'x'. If there are multiple assembly-lines involved in synthesis of the main product, these can be indicated as 'A1, A2, A3, etc.' and 'B1, B2, B3'. Similarly, if the assembly-line branches at a later stage to make multiple products, the shared part can be called e.g. '1, 2, 3' and the split part 'A4, A5' and 'B4, B5'. Up to four parallel assembly-lines are supported (with letters A-D).

aa_type.description: Enter 'None' if module is skipped or inactive.

other_spec.title: Specify other amino acid
other_spec.description: Use the monomer nomenclature from NORINE whenever possible.

multiple_spec.title: Specify promiscuous amino acid specificity
multiple_spec.description: Input multiple amino acids, separated by semi-colons (';'). Use the monomer nomenclature from NORINE whenever possible.

subcluster.title: Sub-cluster for amino acid biosynthesis, if within this gene cluster
subcluster.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas. A sub-cluster only needs to be declared once, in case there are multiple instances of the nonproteinogenic amino acid in the assembly-line.

evidence_a_spec.title: Evidence
evidence_a_spec.description: Choose 'None' if substrate specificity not known or not applicable.

cdom_subtype.title: Subtype of condensation domain in this module
cdom_subtype.description: Epimerization domains are not counted as C domains, but as a separate domain type.

mod_skip_iter.title: Module skipped or iterated during biosynthesis?

te_type.title: Thioesterase type:
te_type.description: Also choose 'None' if it concerns a hybrid pathway and the thioesterase is an integral part of a PKS module at the end of the assembly-line.

thioesterase.title: Thioesterase-encoding gene(s):
thioesterase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

pk_subclass.title: Polyketide subclass
pk_subclass.description: Also choose 'Other' if the polyketide is a hybrid of multiple polyketide types.

lin_cycl_nrp.description: Also counts as cyclic if the molecule is hybrid and the polyketide cyclizes onto another part of the hybrid molecule. Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids or ketide groups do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected.

pks_subclass.title: Polyketide synthase subclass
pks_subclass.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items. The 'Modular Type I' option denotes the presence of cis-AT modules. If the pathway is a hybrid NRPS-PKS pathway, select the type of PKS responsible for the polyketide-synthesizing part of the pathway.

_key.title: PKS-encoding gene:
_key.description: Modular polyketide synthase-encoding gene; Enter locus tag, protein ID or gene ID (in this order of preference) exactly as it is specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry.

module_nr.title: Assembly line module number
module_nr.description:
Enter the modules from N- to C-terminus in this gene.
 Counting starts from 1 at the start of the assembly-line (which can cover multiple genes), and includes loading modules (which are numbered '0'). Every module with at least an substrate-selecting domain (A / AT / CAL) is included in the count. If a module is split over two genes, the same number can be re-used for the domain(s) in the second gene. For hybrids, NRPS modules are included in the counting. If this PKS module is not part of a main assembly-line for producing this compound or if the PKS complex is too noncanonical to describe in a linear fashion, please enter 'x'. The same applies for monomodular precursor synthases such as MSAS synthase, which may be encoded within larger multi-modular PKS-encoding gene clusters. If there are multiple assembly-lines involved in synthesis of the main product, these can be indicated as 'A1, A2, A3, etc.' and 'B1, B2, B3'. Similarly, if the assembly-line branches at a later stage to make multiple products, the shared part can be called e.g. '1, 2, 3' and the split part 'A4, A5' and 'B4, B5'. Up to four parallel assembly-lines are supported (with letters A-D).

pks_domains.title: Core PKS domains present in this module
pks_domains.description: Hold ctrl or cmd key to select multiple items

at_substr_spec.title: AT/CAL domain substrate specificity
at_substr_spec.description: Enter 'None' if no AT-domain present (e.g., for trans-AT modules) or module is skipped. Enter 'Unknown' if specificity not known.

multiple_spec.title: Specify promiscuous keto group specificity
multiple_spec.description: Input multiple keto groups, separated by semi-colons (';'). Use the exact same spelling as denoted in the multiple-choice option above.

evidence_at_spec.title: Evidence for AT/CAL specificity
evidence_at_spec.description: Choose 'None' if substrate specificity not known or not applicable.

kr_stereochem.title: KR domain stereochemistry / activity
kr_stereochem.description: A-group / B-group according to Caffrey, ChemBioChem 2003.

mod_doms.title: Nonreductive scaffold-modifying domains in this module
mod_doms.description: Any additional modifications made by domains within module

mod_skip_iter.title: Module skipped or iterated during biosynthesis?

pks_genes.title: Genes in cluster encoding polyketide synthases / ketosynthases
pks_genes.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas. For Type II PKSs, do not include chain length factor-encoding genes.

nr_iterations.title: Number of chain synthesis iterations performed by iterative PKS module

iter_cycl_type.title: Iterative PKS cyclization type
iter_cycl_type.description: Cyclization type according to Zhou, Li & Tang, Nat. Prod. Rep., 2010,27, 839-868.

trans_at.title: Genes in cluster encoding trans-acyltransferases
trans_at.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

ketide_length.title: Polyketide length
ketide_length.description: Length of the ketide chain, e.g. 6 for a hexaketide or 9 for a nonaketide.

cyclases.title: Gene(s) in cluster encoding polyketide cyclase(s) / aromatase(s)
cyclases.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

te_type.title: Thioesterase type:
te_type.description: Also choose 'None' if it concerns a hybrid pathway and the thioesterase is an integral part of an NRPS module at the end of the assembly-line.

thioesterase.title: Thioesterase-encoding gene(s):
thioesterase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

lin_cycl_ripp.description: Internal cyclizations of an amino acid or cyclizations of two adjacent amino acids do not count to define a cyclic compound: a cyclization should bridge residues that would otherwise not be connected.

precursor_loci.title: Genes in cluster encoding RiPP precursor peptides

gene_id.title: Gene ID:
gene_id.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference) that make up this operon, exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

core_pept_aa.title: RiPP core peptide amino acid sequence
core_pept_aa.description: Input sequence as single-AA abbreviations, e.g. 'ITSISLCTPGCKTGALMGCNMKTATCHCSIHVSK'

lead_pept_len.title: Length of the leader peptide
lead_pept_len.description: Length in AA, including N-terminal signal if present.

cleavage_recogn_site.title: Amino acid sequence of cleavage recognition site, if known

recogn_motif.title: Recognition motif in leader peptide for modification peptide

peptidase.title: Peptidase(s) involved in precursor cleavage
peptidase.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are used in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

AA_pos_1.title: Position of first amino acid involved

AA_pos_2.title: Position of second amino acid involved

terpene_c_len.title: Terpene subclass by number of carbon units

terpene_synth_cycl.title: Genes in cluster encoding terpene synthases/cyclases
terpene_synth_cycl.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

prenyl_transf.title: Genes in cluster encoding prenyltransferases
prenyl_transf.description: Enter locus tags, protein IDs or gene IDs (in this order of preference), exactly as they are specified in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry, separated by commas.

gt_genes.title: Genes in cluster encoding glycosyl transferases

_key.title: Gene ID
_key.description: Enter locus tag, protein ID or gene ID (in this order of preference), exactly as it is used in the submitted GenBank/ENA/DDBJ entry.

sugar_subcluster.title: Sub-cluster for sugar biosynthesis, if within this gene cluster
sugar_subcluster.description: Enter locus tags, gene IDs or protein IDs, separated by commas. A sub-cluster only needs to be declared once, in case there are multiple glycosyltransferases with the same substrate specificity.

comments.title: Please write any final comments here.

embargo.description: For newly characterized gene clusters only. You will be sent an accession number that you can mention in the paper. Please notify us upon publication so that the embargo can be lifted.
